SENT.plain: A case of a 45 years old man with an atherosclerotic stenosis of right internal carotid and TIA event is reported
The patient showed an increase of total cholesterol and LDL-cholesterol serum levels and, in particular, a very low familiar HDL2-cholesterol serum value
The possibility that this last condition could represent an important co-factor of the extracranial cerebrovascular disease is discussed
The usefulness of a long-term follow-up of all family members, showing the same lipids pattern, is also suggested
